definition: eye-opening ceremony for a religious idol (Buddhism)/to consecrate/to bless/transparent/translucent/haircut/shaving the head or face (humorous)/a method of decoration/first light (astronomy)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: All the Images are inserted with relic pill and are consecrated.
sentences.chinese: 所有的佛像都裝有舍利丸並已開光。

sentences.english: Wipes all window sills, doors, and walls when needed, as well as light switches.
sentences.chinese: 若必要，用溼抹布擦所有窗臺，門，牆面以及燈開光。

sentences.english: The Grand Opening Ceremony is being held.

definition: Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
calabash or bottle gourd (Lagenaria siceraria)/hoist/generic term for block and tackle (or parts thereof)/muddled/(poker) full house
lotus flower (Nelumbo nucifera Gaertn, among others)/water-lily
